pullRequest.title: DHFPROD-5942: Assume DHS Usage by default.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

Assume DHS usage by default.
Ability to run tests on DHS
Running tests using gradle.

Checklist:
- Note: do not change the below


Owner:


 JIRA_ID included in all the commit messages


 PR title is in the format JIRA_ID:Title


 Rebase the branch with upstream


 Squashed all commits into a single commit


 Added Tests


Reviewer:


 Reviewed Tests

nodes.bodyText:
Toss a line above this just to space it out from the version numbers.
Then - these properties are going to be used for testing in any environment, right?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,3 +1,6 @@
 junitJupiterVersion=5.4.0
 junitPlatformVersion=1.4.0
 sparkVersion=2.4.5
+#Properties to be used for testing locally using gradle

nodes.bodyText: Assuming you're using Intellij, be sure to do a Reformat Code on every file - I have option-command-L as a shortcut for that, I forget if it's a default in Intellij. That'll ensure that we don't get a bunch of changes to this file in another PR when someone does run Reformat Code.
For consistency with other DHF props, do "hubDhs" and "isDhs" (that's consistent with "Ssl", for example).

commit.message: DHFPROD-5942: Assume DHS Usage by default.

beforeCommit.message: DHFPROD-5942: Assume DHS Usage by default.

afterCommit.message: DHFPROD-5942: Assume DHS Usage by default.

nodes.bodyText: This should be "hubDhs", right? I believe "hubDHS" will still work because it gets lowercased, but we should still use hubDhs.
